intro: Cheirostemon californicus, commonly known as the California evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that open in the evening and close by morning. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Botanically, it belongs to the family Onagraceae and is known for its ecological importance to pollinators.
